intro: Actinostemon guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana starwort, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
